markdown: Fort Lauderdale, Florida. A city laced with 165 miles of waterways. And six miles of uninterrupted wide sandy ocean beach. The perfect setting for Bahia Mar's 40-acre island retreat. Smack dab in the heart of the city and Florida's famous Gold Coast. But in a world all its own. Bahia Mar is just five miles from Fort Lauderdale/Hollywood International Airport and minutes from horse and dog racing, jai alai, major league baseball and Fort Lauderdale Strikers soccer. Also minutes from exclusive shopping on Las Olas Boulevard, more than 200 fine restaurants and nightlife that rivals the day-life. Nearby, there are dozens of challenging golf courses and public tennis courts, including Holiday Park where Chris Evert's father is the pro. For sightseeing, cruise the Intracoastal Waterway aboard the Jungle Queen Paddle- wheeler or charter just about any kind of sail or power boat you prefer-20' to 100' - at Bahia Mar's marina. On land, the Voyager sightseeing train visits the orange groves, Ocean World and the Seminole Indian Village. Or you can visit the 180-acre Birch State Park and take a three mile railroad tour. But, just as importantly, you don't have to leave the resort to enjoy yourself. <::A 2x2 grid of four black and white photographs. The top-left photo shows several people playing golf on a green with a flag in the distance. The top-right photo features a man in a hat holding up a large fish, possibly a mahi-mahi, next to a woman. The bottom-left photo depicts a fishing boat or yacht on the water, viewed from the front. The bottom-right photo shows a paddlewheel boat with the name "JUNGLE QUEEN IV" visible on its side.: figure::> Gift of the Sea. <::A black and white photograph of a beach scene. Several tall palm trees with dense fronds are scattered across the sandy foreground, casting shadows. In the mid-ground, there are multiple wooden picnic tables with benches, some appearing to have small grills or trash cans nearby. The sand extends to the ocean, which has gentle waves breaking on the shore. A faint figure of a person can be seen walking near the water's edge in the distance. The sky is bright and clear above the ocean. : photo::> <::A black and white photograph of a marina filled with numerous boats docked along piers. In the foreground, out-of-focus palm fronds partially obscure the view, casting shadows across the lower portion of the image. The boats vary in size and style, with some appearing to be yachts or cabin cruisers. The water in the marina is visible between the boats and piers.: figure::> Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/lmmf0227
